transcript.text: the problem of relevance and influence
is even more acute for Anarchist fellow
Travelers as you often describe yourself
for the fact is that mass-based
anarchism movements have been defeated
and have essentially disappeared long
ago one could in fact reasonably argue
that the actual movement is weak
disorganized and full of SE sectarian
quarrels so my question is my first
question what is the relevance and the
meaning of anarchism today and what do
you think are those least desirable
aspects of today's anarchism that should
be addressed and corrected if the
movement is to have relevance in today's
struggles uh first of all there weren't
many mass-based Anarchist movements
there was one major one in Spain in
1936 and that one was indeed uh uh
destroyed by The Joint uh efforts of U
the Communists the fascists and the
liberal democracies they all wanted to
destroy the anarchist Revolution they
then turned to squabbling with each
other about what was left uh other Mass
popular movements continued to develop U
uh sometimes successfully sometimes not
but I don't feel quite as defe about it
as uh Norman's U comment suggests uh
even if the anarchist movements dissolve
they penetrate uh other uh activist
movements most of the uh activism that I
know of um including current activism
tracing back many years uh is inspired
by anist elements they may not call
themselves Anarchist but the concept of
U address
ing structures of dominance and
hierarchy and challenging them that's
been a core feature of modern activist
movements as of earlier ones many which
would not at all call themselves
Anarchist so the feminist movement for
example was a challenging uh deeply
entrenched structures of domination of
uh uh
subordination raising consciousness
about the uh uh the imperative of
understanding that subordination is not
a Act of Life approaching others to try
to get them to think through their their
own uh assumptions that somehow orders

them the same is true of the workers

indigenous movements I mean the
indigenous movements of Latin America
for example that would not not call

fact expressing developing in their own

these Concepts just arise spontaneously
all the time in activist movements
individual lives and so on and in so far
as the
anarchists those who call themselves
anarchists or Draw EXP licitly from the
anarchist tradition in so far as they
can contribute to all of this that's
just fine as to the least desirable
aspects of anarchism they there are many
one of them is the uh extreme sectarian
character of the organized movements
just to
illustrate the one place where there are
there remain for a long time still are
large Act Anarchist movements is still
in Spain they uh they revived after the
Franco dictatorship ended they were sort
of deeply rooted in people's
Consciousness and understanding and the
major Anarchist trade movement CNT just
still still functions I happened to be
in Spain in 1986 I guess on Mayday and
there were Mass
demonstrations there was a Socialist
Workers demonstration ation and there
were two Anarchist demonstrations they
couldn't get together so they had two
separate demonstrations going and my
wife and I had to kind of decide which
one we wanted to march in but uh we
thought for a while she might go in one
I might go in the other
but uh but that kind of uh sectarian
attitude can be very self-defeating and
destructive should certainly be
overcome uh if the movement is to have

Madison Wisconsin in the last couple of
weeks which is pretty important
substantial popular
uprisings struggling for workers rights
defense of democracy and so on there are
many elements involved but some of them
are in fact organized Anarchist groups
so the iww the international workers of
the world is has been to some extent
reconstituted after a after it was
bitterly attacked virtually destroyed by
uh American progressives by woodro
Wilson and his associates many years ago
it's revived uh not huge but it's active
and uh is among the elements
participating in and
um energizing the popular movements that
are taking place so I don't think that
uh we should should be be so defeatist
in our picture of what these movements
are and have accomplished now the the
groups that call themselves Anarchist
that's a different story they are of all
kinds of imaginable types there's
nothing General to say about them but
the I think the basic
uh ideas driving Concepts that have been
at the heart of the
major Anarchist developments
for well well into well into the 19th
century these these remain are
constantly revived they're uh because
they're very natural they're the kinds
of uh points of view and attitudes that

what's possible
